    > 
    > 3. **The Good Samaritan (Luke 10:25-37)**:
    >    - In this parable, Jesus tells the story of a Samaritan who helps a traveler who has been beaten and left for dead, whereas others, including a priest and a Levite, pass by without offering assistance.     > 
    > 4. **David and Bathsheba**:

    >    - While being crucified next to Jesus, one of the criminals recognizes Jesus’ innocence and asks Him to remember him when He enters His kingdom.     >

    >    - This psalm declares God’s merciful character, saying, “The Lord is compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in love. He does not treat us as our sins deserve or repay us according to our iniquities” (Psalm 103:8-10). This text encapsulates the essence of divine mercy.
